intro: Ferulago carduchorum, commonly known as the Armenian fumitory, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Ferulago carduchorum is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
